content: "{\"object\":\"value\",\"document\":{\"object\":\"document\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Hybrid\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" \",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{}}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"cloud is a composition of two or more clouds that remain distinct entities but are bound together, offering the benefits of multiple deployment models.\",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" \",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{}}}]},{\"object\":\"inline\",\"type\":\"link\",\"data\":{\"url\":\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gartner\"},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Gartner, Inc.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" defines a hybrid cloud service as a cloud computing service that is composed of some combination of private, public and community cloud services, from different service providers.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"EPAM Cloud by its nature is a hybrid cloud, as it supports integration with other cloud providers (AWS and Microsoft Azure) and allows using its native tools to manage virtual resources in AWS and Azure clouds. This is a truly powerful solution for projects needing to have their development and production environments in other clouds. The development process is performed in EPAM Cloud that is not accessible for external connections, while the production is deployed to AWS or Azure Cloud. Users can enjoy the extended functionality and different capacities offered in different clouds, and some limitations of one cloud can be compensated by another.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"In addition, EPAM Orchestrator not only allows using public clouds services via its own tools, but, if necessary, provides access to native AWS and Azure consoles with their full functionality.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"image\",\"data\":{\"src\":\"https://onboarding.epam.com/app/cdn/7ff98bc7-410a-4abd-b7ee-5b458fec96f3/image2016-12-6%2016:59:30.png\",\"imageSize\":{\"width\":611,\"height\":317}},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"It is important, that EPAM Cloud does not apply any additional fee for external cloud usage. Project teams are charged for AWS and Azure resources and services according to the respective vendor's pricing policies.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"EPAM Cloud team is not responsible for any changes in performance and billing strategy of the third-party services/applications integrated with Cloud.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\\n\\n\",\"marks\":[]}]}]}}"
